Standard order of BBQ chicken salad and a BBQ chicken pizza....I know so boring.  The menu is four stars as they are clearly trying to innovate.  Several pizza and salad options.  Good drink menu with many wine and drink options.   Interesting Diet Pepsi "mixed" drink menu.  Good customer service.  Clean restrooms I will return.

My husband and I were shopping at the mall, so decided to stop here for dinner.  Have been to various CPK's across the nation and this was about the same.  We started with the vegetarian egg rolls which were stuffed with eggplant, roasted veggies, and cheese served with marinara sauce.  DId not really care for these, but ate them because we were starving.  We split the mushroom pizza, which was pretty good.  My personal favorite is the tostada pizza, however would get this one again as well.  Kale salad (new item on the menu) sounded delish, but did not think I would be able to eat that plus the pizza.  Service was just mediocre.  We were never served bread as everyone else around us was and our drinks were never refilled without us asking.  Seemed like the server was too busy to give us adequate attention.  We did do a survey at the request of the hostess which got us $5 off our meal, as well as a coupon for $5 off our next meal.  Seems a bit pricey for the quality of the food-$35 between the 2 of us.

Like a reliable old friend, California Pizza Kitchen is there to make you feel at home, feed you a good meal, and take care of you.  CPK delivers on all fronts.  This was one of their first locations to remodel for their new look, and even though I was skeptical at first, I think it works well.  Service here has always been terrific, and I feel like the food has gotten even better.  I particularly like the California Club pizza and am a big fan of their salads, while my wife almost always gets the Kung Pao spaghetti.  The beer selection is also good and even includes some local options.  The other thing that works well for us is the kids' menu - it ensures that everyone in the family goes home happy!

Calzone Were Pretty Good But Pepperoni Pizza Is So, So                                              My folks and I had stopped here, service is food and helpful. Pepperoni were cut in paper-thin plus they had put on very little pepperoni with nearly no taste. This pizza taste something like just only cheese. Crust is very thin. Hardly any people come here around 6:30PM. Your choices; go elsewhere for pizza places.
It is a decent establishment but sadly I saw a cockroach by the bar. I thought this place was remodeled recently.

Food was 45 minutes late for curbside pick-up.  Finally they brought out the food and, *gasp* surprise! Wrong order! The runner girl was friendly at first but became very pissy with us as time went on. Girl comes running back 5 minutes later with the correct order, yay! We hand her a tip and before she takes off my wife looks through the new bag and says "Hey wait a minute, there still isn't any topping for my salad"  What does the runner girl do? In a very annoyed tone she says "Okay THANKS!" and runs off with her tip. We waited for about a half hour for this curbside experience which the company defines as a quick and easy way to get your food to go. It was neither quick, nor easy, and in the end we were STILL given the wrong food and CPK essentially told us "TOUGH LUCK!". Horrible customer service.  Now to the food!  We get home and, oh look, random things we didn't order are in the bag! Yay! Well let's just salvage our meal and- The food was so cold and so stiff that it became quickly apparent that it WAS ready when we first arrived, but just sat somewhere while we twiddled our thumbs for a half hour.  STONE cold. Stiff like cardboard. We threw it away. Avoid this place like the plague. I've had CPK before and the food itself (when fresh) is delicious, the problem with THIS place is the STAFF.  I look forward to an email from the manager trying to make this right - which based on the horrible service we had this evening - I will never receive.  Avoid this place until they fire some of the crappy staff and hire people who actually care about customers.

Oh boy it has been five years since I had been here.  Which is weird because I like this place for both the salads and pizza.  Came here tonight for Valentines with the wife.  She picked CPK and I was cool with it.  We got super lucky and they were running a Valentines special which meant pick one appetizer(sesame chicken potstickers), two entrees(kung pao chicken spaghetti & BBQ chicken pizza) and to top it off we also got one dessert(Red Velvet Cake w/ice cream).  All of that for $30.  Great deal.  App would of been 8, dinner 15 & 13 with dessert 7.50+1.50 for ice cream.  Add that up(uses calculator because he is not smart)45 bucks!!!  Spaghetti was different but I liked it a lot and the BBQ chicken pizza was always classic.  Service was a little slow but nothing to complain about.  I was also surprised on the deal how many entrees they let you choose from(probably about 10).  Happy Made Up Hallmark Holliday everyone!!! P.S. Forgot to mention, the special actually runs through the weekend in case you were interested.

CPK is my place for when I'm in the mood for pizza but feeling a little more adventurous than your standard pepporini pizza (and have a little more money to spend, of course).  The food is consistently good and the cocktails are yummy. J's personal fav is the Habanero Carnitas pizza, although he says it could stand to be spicier. There are several menu items that always catch my eye that sadly I will never order, because I cannot stop ordering the Pear & Gorgonzola Pizza! OH SWEET THIN-CRUST PIZZA JESUS, THE PEAR AND GORGONZOLA!!! That pizza is good for words. Coherent words that make sense through excessive drooling, anyway.
The vegi pizza and mahi mahi tacos were pretty good. Lauren the manager was delightful and conscientious about all customers and made the slow server service bearable.  Thx again Lauren.
This place never disappoints when you want a really good salad,  I also like the Jamacian Jerk Chicken Pizza.

Liked the old look CPK had but it was a little outdated and was very commercial and cookie cutter chain restaurant. Love Love the new CPK! Feels like you are in a totally different restaurant but you already know the food is delish. The communal tables are fun and great for people watching. The bar is nice now we go to CPK due to its a destination restaurant not just because we are in the area. Keep up the great food and love the herb garden for fresh food and cocktails. Also noticed the customer service they have once again raised the bar. Customer service has always been fabulous at CPK but whatever changes they made to make each diner feel like they are friends please keep it up! Thank you CPK for making our Arden location be the first to have all the changes! Now I'm hungry!!!

This is the 3rd time I've eaten at this location so its about time I wrote a review.  I must say up front that the service is always attentive and at this visit it was very good in a Sacramento kind of way.  the server went out of his way to make sure to answer any questions and to be helpful.     I ordered Creamy pesto pasts and a salad off of the small plates menu and my partner ordered the pear and Gorgonzola pizza.  The one that I don't like about the menu is that it is a bit pricey.  They offer a large selections of salads but they are not really something I would order on the side due to cost.   they currently have a small plates menu and when you sign up for their "club" one item from the menu is free.  Our server set up up for this promotion so I was about to have a salad with my past without breaking the bank.    Pizza's are great here as they should be as its in the name CPK.  My pasta was good not great but I am not always in a pizza mood so its good to have a choice.  They also have Mexican food on the menu but it is always a bit confusing to me as if I wanted Mexican we would have gone to Mexican restaurant.
Great food, super nice and attentive waitress what more can one ask for..? P.s. Her name is brittany(::

I found myself with 40 minutes in between conference meetings to grab something to eat.  I drove down Arden Way and ended up at CPK.  I needed food for lunch and dinner and decided to pick up a half salad and pizza. I got the chopped salad which consisted of lettuce, basil, mozzarella, turkey, salami, tomatoes, garbanzo beans (on request) and a vinaigrette.  The salad was good and a decent lunch size. For dinner I got the goat cheese and peppers pizza.  It also had eggplant and caramelized onions on it.  It was also good but the veggies were mushy.   I expect eggplant to have a little bit of a mushy texture but I like my peppers to have at least a little bit of a bite to them.  The hostess was very friendly and quickly pointed me in the right direction to place a to go order. Unfortunately, I had to wait for the server taking to go orders to have a break in her personal phone call to take my order.  She didn't even pretend that the call wasn't personal.  She was talking to a friend about college courses while I stood waiting patiently to place my order. I almost chimed in with wise college graduate type advice but decided to refrain and just continue waiting patiently.  Once I placed my order it was filled in around 10 minutes and the server, now done with her phone call, was very nice.

Went out with a group of friends this week and after seeing a movie we thought we'd stop in CPK. I always get their Thai Chicken Pizza. Our server was cool and the food was decent (cmon it's CPK not fine dining!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!). He was great about refills and our order modifications. The big turnoff was the hostesses. Snarly, snipey rude ass b-tches. Man, they were hella rude to the couple in front of us and then pulled attitude with my buddy. I get it your working a minimum wage job and it may not be enough to pay for your 50 pounds of eyeliner and your crack habit (gottsta stay skinny) but that's no reason to act like a jerk to customers.

It was my first time here, and I came here with 2 other friends..We ordered the Thai Chicken and Chipotle Chicken Pizza.  Out of the two pizzas, I recommend getting the chipotle chicken pizza because the flavors were delicous!  Although the THai chicken is all the hype, I didn't really like the peanut sauce as much, but its a good experience to try it! I liked the sauce and presentation because it was sorta-like a taco salad.  However, I did not know you can't order breadsticks at this place.  What type of pizza place doesnt have breadsticks? or garlic sticks? but, it'll all good..instead, we got the complementary french bread (it was a bit hard, but it was good enough to munch on before the pizza arrived) Overall, the place was alrite, it was a bit pricey, but better than the frozen cpk pizzas..I'd come back to try other favors and the chipotle chicken tho! L

Our server was waiting on 3 other tables besides ours, 2:30pm so that's after the lunch rush. We had to ask several times for bread & water.  Waited forever for a glass of wine.  Paid $1 extra for thin crust pizza, it's supposed to be crispier. Pizza crust was very crispy on the edges, but soggy in the middle.  Go to the grocery store & purchase a CPK pizza & bake it yourself!
The service was the best service we have ever received at a CPK.  Alexis was fantastic!  The meal also rocked.  We had a Thai Chix Pizza and the Morrocan Salad.  Thanks Alexis for making it so great.

My girlfriend introduced me to this place.  By far this place has the best pizza and pastas ever. I love the chipotle chicken pizza and the 4 cheese ravioli it is absolutely delicious. The chipotle chicken pizza has a spicy taste to it and that fulfills my taste buds. The 4 cheese ravioli is to die for, it's a perfect portion for one. To end the night I order the red velvet cake for desert.

Very bad experience.  My girlfriend wanted to have some pasta for lunch, so I decide to go to California pizza kitchen. We arrived here around 3:15 pm, and my girlfriend ordered chicken tequila fettuccine, strawberry mango cooler, and avocado egg roll. I was not sure what should I have, so I asked him come back for my order. After 20 min, there was nothing on the table. Another 10 min later, thanks god, the waiter finally remembered us. He brought my girlfriend's drink and checked our order. Then I ordered a mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza. 15 min later, we finally had egg roll and pizza on the table. Wait a second, what was our purpose to come here? Where was the pasta? You won't believe that the waiter came and apologized he forgot the pasta. Well, it had been 1 hour and 15 min, we finally had the pasta on the table. People who were behind us already checked out and left. Maybe the waiter was rushing the chef, the pasta was kinda tough to eat. I remember I had the same experience at Season 52 that they forgot one of my order, but they took out that order off the bill. Maybe that's the difference between a great restaurant and regular restaurant.

I was never a big fan of their pizza, it was always good but not great... I came here for lunch a few months ago however, and they changed my mind...and it had nothing to do with the pizza! They have a new lighter calorie, inexpensive lunch menu with fun things like "white corn and asparagus salad" (I think that was the title)  and mini chicken quesadillas... My lunch mate and I got 4 different items (none pizza) and they were all very tasty! Not to mention cheap and easy on the waistline....our server was very nice, we got everything on-time and hot I don't come here very often, but I was surprisingly impressed....

I came here with a party of ten on a Saturday night. The hostess said it would be about a 30-45 minute wait which was more reasonable than the 2 hr wait at Elephant Bar and Cheesecake Factory that are in the area. We totally forgot it was graduation and prom!  The hostess was very kind and attentive. She gave us updates on the status of our table as we waited.  The food was good-not great. I would give this place 3 stars based on food but since the service was exceptional, I had to give them 4 stars. My husband ordered the clam fettuccine dish. Turns out it was a spicy dish. He is not fond of spicy dishes so that would have been nice to know before he ordered it. I think it should be mentioned on the menu but wasn't.  Our waitress was pretty good. She had a lot of tables but came to check on us every once in awhile. However, she did forget to bring the beer my husband ordered. We had a birthday girl at our table and requested a strawberry shortcake be brought out for her. The waitress took it off our bill which was nice!
Always good.  I love the BBQ chicken salad. Crunchy fresh and yummy.  Pizzas are all good the chipolte chicken with the green sauce on top is my favorite
I always love CPK's fresh cobb salad and bacon bbq sauce pizza very friendly service and great quality food in cheap prices :)

I highly recommend the Chicken Piccata...very tasty, yummy, and you can't find it everywhere.  Even though this is primarily a pizza place, I come here for the pasta and small plates. Don't be fooled by the fact that they don't display all their spirits behind the bar.  It's a full bar and the bartenders can customize your drinks as you like.
Great food...pizza was tasty and not greasy like Pizza Hut...eewwwwe. Good variety on the menu. Customer service was fine as well. I go about once or twice a month :-p

For my dads birthday he wanted to go around trying pizza places throughout Sacramento and reviewing them. Then have me post them on his behalf. This is our fourth review. Parking and Location: 3 stars. It is in the mall. That sums it up pretty well. Looks From Outside: 4 stars: Just the way a mall should look. Nice big windows, updated look, and clean. Looks From Inside: 4 stars It was very clean and comfortable. Very generic chain restaurant look. Wait Time: 4 stars. We were sat very quickly, didn't wait long for food. Customer Service: 2 stars: Customer service was good until our food got there and we had no silverware, plates, or napkins.  It took us a long time to get someone's attention as our food got cold. Menu: 3 stars: The menu is very speratic. A pizza restaurant that serves Chinese, Mexican, Italian, and even a Korean dish. The drink menu was good, a nice selection of beers. Price: 3 stars: The price was very average for the one size fits all pizza style. Although my daughter ordered a thin crust pizza and I a regular pepperoni, her pizza was twice the size of mine with the same amount of toppings for the same price. Food: 2 stars : The sauce was a little sweet and tomato paste tasting. The pepperoni was just ok not overly spicy. The sausage was nothing special. It was a very generic unimpressive pizza. It reminded me of defrosted pizza. Our beer was bad. We told the manager and she said checked and said we got the bottom of the keg. Total: 3.25 stars: Either the food wasn't that awful or we were very hungry because we both finished our pizza. I can't say I will be back or recommend it anyone.

The General Manager, Scott Ramirez, is at his best when he is under fire.  When we visited the restaurant, he was short-staffed, and our order got lost in the shuffle.  When our food did arrive, my waldorf chicken salad was missing the chicken!  Scott took over the service to our table personally, remedied the missing items and delivered a complimentary new dessert for us to try.  He spent a few moments talking to us, and did a great job of salvaging the situation.  We appreciated his professionalism, and attention to detail.

THE BEST TIRAMISU EVER!!! No joke, get the tiramisu... even if you're not hungry save it for later. For just over $6, you can easily share this with someone and still have leftovers. Oh ya, the salads and pizza are killer too!

The price of mediocrity keeps rising. Canned diced tomatoes on a pizza? If you want a pizza with any tell-tale sign of flavor to it, go elsewhere. If I want any more of their pizza, I'll look for it in the frozen food section of the supermarket.

It would've been 2 stars but our server, Michael, was funny and great. There are 5 hosts standing at the front to ignore you when you come in; the place is half empty but there's a 10 minute wait. Then the general manager brought us our food wearing a uniform with food on it and our appetizer arrived with our entrees....And was cold. Fail CPK.

I cannot suggest this restaurant. We had a Salad and a Pizza to share! But the Pizza was served as cold as the Salad! Additionally you sit beside the Window which has only one glas and is fu**ing cold, so it helps to freeze your cold food. Maybe the soda is freeflow, but I did not get a second one! Thanks a lot!

I agree with Cam. J/K!!! HAHA. Actually, since I had just ran an errand with my sister and we were starving for some casual fare, her boyfriend volunteered CPK.  And although my experiences here have been a hit/miss situations, I agreed, especially since B&N was next door. I could scoot over there right thereafter and look for the Gurskey collection of photographs. We were seated immediately and served ice teas, of which we promptly sent back to the kitchen.  First sip was okay, but as it slid down our throat, it left a nasty acrid bitterness.  We thought it could have been the batch, so with the second failed attempt, we sent it back.  Weird. Menu here is pretty extensive, with lots of pizzas (different combinations, such as the Kung Pao pizza or the Mango Tandoori Chicken) reflecting a fusion oriented cuisine.  My sister opted for their salad of tossed greens with pears, candied walnuts, and feta cheese.  I chose a cup of their Adobe Chicken soup while her boyfriend selected the Sedona Tortilla Soup.  The Adobe Chicken soup was pretty good, chunky with lots of corn, chicken and brown rice.  A thick creamy base with their sourdough bread would have been the perfect lunch meal. My Chicken Caesar Sandwich on Foccacia bread was not bad, but a little dry.  I was expecting more chicken meat and more dressing.  But it was still good.  My sis's boyfriend's pizza was a bit off (White Sauce Bacon pizza) in that there was a lot of smoky bacon flavor, but not enough cheese and I think it was mostly in part to the lack of spinach, since they elected to not carry spinach yet. In all, the meal was mediocre and it further cemented my sister's reason why she did not want to come here.  Pricey and food was not all that, but at least our server was on the ball.  Kudos and the good tip to her for keeping our food interests afloat.

Best pizza ever! I had the California club which was very good, our waiter was great also very nice and checked on us a lot. 1st time here and i loved it! Love their decorations,furniture and service.

I've always loved CPK. I go here specifically for the Chicken Tequila Fettucine. It's a pretty ample portion that comes with spinach fettucine noodles, the sweetest bell peppers ever, red onions, huge chunks of chicken and a squeeze of lime to set off the tequila. So tasty! I've also had their pizzas before and the ingredients used are always fresh , but kind of expensive for a pizza. Yesterday I had the avocado egg roll things for an appetizer and they were OK. The service is always quick and efficient too and for a Friday night, it wasn't as packed as I thought it would be. I will be back!

I get a little upset with these guys because they keep changing the menu, but since it gives me a chance to try new things..that I end up liking even better...I forgive them. Great service. Knowledgeable staff! Great food recommendations, and I appreciate that.

The salads and pizza are well executed, and the customer service is friendly!  I have been here a couple of times, and each time it's been consistently good.  I like the arugula and asparagus salad, which is the stated ingredients plus peanuts in a light vinaigrette.  Its a nice started to the meal to come, and it has a nice mix of flavors.  Most recently I had the mushroom pizza on thin crust with truffle oil, which is extra but it pairs nicely with the umami flavor of the mushrooms.  This pizza rocked!  It had a perfectly crispy crust, rich and creamy cheese, an array of mushrooms that was topped off with a drizzle of truffle oil.  All of these decadent flavors were perfectly incorporated and each ingredient shined!  It is so simple yet so Devine!  The ambiance is bright, loud, and very open.  This made for a very kid friendly atmosphere and both my boys had a good time!  I liked the fact that they got little CPK reusable plastic cups with lids too!  Overalls is a great place tot ale the family and have a good meal!

I haven't been to cpk in years but it used to be one of my favorites. It seems like quality has gone way down to appeal to more people. It wasn't bad it was just ok which was really disappointing because I used to love it. I may try it again but it could just be another case of a restaurant evolving during the recession into gross food lol.

My girlfriend and I dropped in for lunch one day while at the mall. There was plenty of open seating, but for some reason the host led us to the back of the restaurant and sat us between 3 tables filled with children. There were maybe 14 kids running around our table screaming while their parents ignored them. Why would the host think that the two of us wanted to sit amidst this anarchy?  I asked to be moved, to which the waiter seemed a little offended, as if we didn't want to sit in his section. The quieter part of the restaurant was much nicer, although the new waitress didn't seem to know we were in her section because we sat for another 20 minutes before getting to order. Overall, not the best dining experience.  But the food was good, just like at any other CPK. I'm a huge fan of the pear and gorgonzola pizza, which comes with an arugula salad on top of it (something that I don't understand, but it is delicious). That's really all I ever order these days, because I know it's a sure thing.  I like CPK, and this location is a nice addition to the Arden mall, but the poor judgment displayed by the host was worth complaining about.

I love the food here but it's a little pricy for the quantity size. After the remodel it looks a lot nicer. The BBQ chicken pizza is really good. I usually don't eat a lot and I got s pizza there usually personals and I got satisfied. So we also got an appetizer which was really great it was the lettuce wraps. They were delivious. I got them without mushrooms or cashews and the sauce was very tasty with the chicken. The spaghetti was kinda dry. I love saucy spaghetti. The desert here is really good. I got a red velvet cake that was moist and delicious.

Went here with my parents while I was home. I've been to several CPKs throughout California and this one was probably the best.  Frankly the food at CPK isn't anything extraordinary, but this time the pizzas were done well and the service was spectacular (hence the 4 stars).  I believe we got the wild mushrooms pizza, the grilled veggies one and a meat one. I can't speak on the last one but the first two were good.

The service here is good and the staff is friendly enough. The food is typical of CPK and well rounded but their menu has not changed much. Ambiance is something that needs to change a bit, as it has not changed over the years, but all in all clean. A good place to go as a backup if you have no where else to go or if you want to be in a sit-in restaurant after going to the theater next door.

CPK has gone completely down the hill. The service here is always bad. This time they even served super stale tortilla chips with my super boiled artichoke dip. The pizza was burnt and all this even tho there were only 5 other people total in the entire place. I'll never return and I caution others to avoid the place.

Ugh.   You know, I'm not even going to bother.  There's a Dos Coyotes right over there to your left.  Just go order the chicken Navajo nachos, you can thank me later. Adequate frozen pizzas with average toppings for $12.99 a piece are not worth reviewing.

This place is not a bad restaurant but it's just not for me and here's why. 1. I really don't need a waitress/waiter when it comes to pizza. I 'd rather save the 15% I spent on a tip and get a pizza to go from somewhere and eat it in the comfort of my home. 2. The pizza's are small and only come in one size. The pizzas are cut into six slices and me and my girlfriend shared one and each of us had a salad. If I didn't have the salad I could have easily eaten one by myself.  3. The pizzas are expensive. I paid $13 for a six slice Chicken and Garlic pizza. My dollar could go way farther somewhere else. Don't get me wrong, the food tasted fine. It was fresh, non greasy, and there was a good variety to choose from. But at the end of the day it just was not worth the tab I racked up. I'm glad I tried it but I definitely won't be going back.

I am a regular at this CPK. The wait staff if always perfect and so is the food. I eat here 3-4 times a month. The food is fresh, it is brought out quickly. The location is perfect because we can go shopping in Arden Mall then have dinner at CPK. The staff has always been attentive and professional. Never less than a 5 star experience for us.
AMAZING SERVICE!!! Best guest service I have ever experienced. Defiantly my new favorite pizza restaurant in California.

I LOVE CPK ! The frozen pizzas don't emulate the taste of a fresh pizza from the restaurant... so if it's your first time, I suggest going to the restaurant!  We had avocado egg rolls and the thai chicken pizza. egg rolls - sooo good! they taste a bit reminiscent of chicken bakes from costco... with avocado in them.  thai chicken pizza - really really really strong taste. it was a crackin' party in my mouth, because there was so much going on. Good, nonetheless... but I like my pizza taste consistent and subtle. If you're a party animal, then I suggest this! CPK never upsets... until this night when my friend and I decided to lie about our birthday in order to get a free birthday sunday. Don't judge, you know you do it too. I went up to our waitress to ask if the restaurant did anything for birthdays... she proceeded to nod in a hospitable manner, as if it would be taken care of.  The sundae came, birthday candle and all. No singing?! fine! we scarfed it down, then looked at the bill. THEY CHARGED US FOR A BIRTHDAY SUNDAE !!! what if it was really our birthday?! well by golly, i'm never coming here for a birthday dinner. neither should you! unless you want to pay for a sundae on your birthday! sheesh!

Always my favorite pizza place cuz of the great menu of so many different types of foods.  Love everything especially the tortilla soup, bianco flatbread, Chinese chicken salad, lettuce wraps, and every pizza I've ever tried is delicious.   Really good kiddie Mac n cheese, too.
It's a great pizza, what else can you say.  Not the cheapest but reasonable for the fancyish incredients.  I loved the spicy meat one.  Dough, sauce, meat and cheeze it's the perfect combo!
I wish I could've tried the food. Sat at our table and the server never showed up, maybe next time

Had I written a review for this place a year ago, I'd have given it a 2.5 stars. I remember it tasting just ok and service being sluggish. However, in the last months this place has very noticeably ramped up their overall work. The menus have good new variety, so much that as a vegetarian I actually have many choices! A very solid 4 Stars. The prices make sense for the quality of food, which is significantly better than I ever recall it being.

Came in on thursday, right before V-day, so they were running a $30 for 2 special. Food was alright, nothing stood out. Our waiter must of been new because he was bad. He forgot to give us the $30 price and rung our meal up separately. It was $20 more then expected. He couldn't pronouce CHIMAY and served it in a pint glass.  CPK please work on better training on your new hires. I guess an another employee was bout to get off and her bf was just hanging out in the dining room waiting for her. Really unprofessional there. He just sat there with a glass of waiter and their baby for 45 mins. A customer was vaping next to us also. All the food establishments I go to ask patrons for vape outside for the courtesy of others.

So pretty much the same experience many people have had here. The service was EXTREMELY slow and it was not busy at all. The waitress seemed like she couldnt handle the tables she was assigned. Our drinks came out 45 mins after we ordered them. Food came out 20 mins after that. Probably wont be coming back
Very different yet tasty pizza :) Love their tostada and lettuce wrap. Like to go to this place quite often.. once every 2-3 months.

Once in a while I'll cave in to eat pizza. Pizza is not my favorite food to eat, but I wanted to try CPK.  I ordered the Asian Duck pizza. Hmm.. Chinese food on pizza? It was actually pretty good! I asked for whole wheat pizza crust to make the pizza somewhat healthier. The duck was scattered on top of the cheese. Hoisin sauce and strips of scallions topped the pizza. The sauce and the scallions gave the pizza the Asian flavor that I'm used to eating in Chinese food. My bf ordered the Wild Mushroom pizza. He loves mushrooms and couldn't resist order it. The pizza had three types of mushrooms and it was pretty good. Unfortunately, the flavors weren't as strong as the Asian pizza. Surprisingly we both finished our pizza. I got a little help from the bf. :) I have no idea why CPK gives each table bread. You figure that the pizza already has enough carbs in it. Why consume even more carbs? If Cheesecake Factory is busy, CPK is a good alternative in the Arden Mall area.

I've been to a few CPK's and this one is my favorite. Yup I know they all serve the same food, but the Arden Fair CPK never let me down. I like hanging out shopping in the mail after my meal and returning for a beer. The wait staff are friendly and courteous. If something is not fixed they way "you" want they will take care of it.  How cool is that!!!

This was a fun and interesting night.  Came here to grab a bite to eat.  It wasn't bad at all.  I've been here before and well it was really good last time. This time well..the sandwich i ordered well it was sloppy put together and well my friends pizza was cold.  Very unusual for CPK.  Although their drinks were strong for my friends. lol....and well the service was ok.  They only had 3 serves for a friday night and the wait was average.
I love CPK for one thing and one thing only.  It's my dirty little secret but I'll share it with you yelpers because we're friends. Buffalo chicken pizza. The end.

Had lunch on a Sunday Afternoon. Service was quick and good. The only issue is that one of the Pizzas were made incorrectly and they had to remake it.  Service staff was professional and comped the pizza making this a good experience. Will return again!

I love this place. Pizza is one of my favorite food, and CPK always satisfies my craving. I go here with my friends once in a while and they all love it too. It is a great hang out place since it is basically right next to the mall and the theaters. The meat cravers pizza is my favorite. The prices may be a bit expensive but it is worth it. The service is mostly good, I have no complaints. I will definitely be going back, no doubt about that.

I love the grilled veggie salad and the goat cheese and roasted pepper pizza on a wheat crust.  Just went there for lunch with coworkers, got a half salad and split the pizza. It's more than enough food that way.  The service is fine.  By this point you are probably asking yourself, "why only three stars if you like it so much?" Well, it's too freakin' expensive for what you get! $10.49 for a half of a grilled veggie salad? Really? Also, the price for drinks really gets my blood boiling - $2.50, oh sorry, $2.49 for iced tea! I know that's where they make their money and it's pretty standard across the board at restaurants now, but sheesh. Most the time I skip it because it pisses me off that they charge so much. But today, I had a hankerin' for iced tea. And now, my blood is boiling, so I thought I'd share my frustration.
It's CPK, yeah its a bit expensive but where else can you find a wide array of selections on pizza and salads.....I like this place on a few and far between occasion. No real complaints.

Where else can you get several shots of whiskey served with a gourmet pizza by a guy/gal in a white shirt and tie?  Macaroni Grill? Oh Yeah, I guess so. Huh? So I used to be a big fan of CPK until they got rid of the best item on their menu. Yes, I'm talkin' about the Peeking Duck Pizza. Man! This pizza ruled so hard core and made my soul smile every time I sank my teeth into its delicious crust. Then one day, I order and the jack ass waiter says they don't serve it anymore. I felt like the guy just raped my girlfriend. I haven't been back since. The pain is too great. Every time I walk or drive by one, tears well up in my eyes remembering all the great Peeking Duck Pizzas I crushed there. They do serve great sourdough bread when you get there. That's cool too. I'm...I'm sorry, this is just too hard. I....I gotta go...

I LOVE THIS PLACE.  Every time I shop at Arden Mall I almost always have to have lunch here or at least take a pizza to go.  My favorite (and I know it sounds crazy) is a plain cheese pizza.  There is something about their cheese and pizza sauce that separates it from others.  And I've tried almost every pizza on the menu!  However, my second favorite is the White Pizza.  It's very delicious!  I also enjoy the lemonades that they have and always get a strawberry lemonade to go with it.  This is a great lunch/dinner place to go to with friends.  Give it a try sometime!  I especially enjoy sitting at the bar and watching the chefs cook the pizzas, it keeps you entertained while you wait for yours.  However, the service is quite fast!

I'm going to keep this short: last year there was a LIVE baby cockroach in my to-go pizza box.  They baked me a new pizza but I couldn't bring myself to eat it. They blamed construction (I think maybe the new Urban Outfitters was under construction) but EW.  Ew.
Food is good but very slow service took 20 minutes to get my bill and it wasn't even busy

Definitely one of my favorite places to go when I'm shopping at Arden. The service is almost always good and even when they're busy the wait times usually aren't too long. The pizza is yummy and the price is right.   The seating can be a little strange. They have these tiny tables where they sometimes sit people when they're super busy. Frankly, it's almost just worth waiting for s booth to open up. They're so small you can barely fit 2 plates and drinks.  Other than that though, highly recommended. The Greek pizza is soooo good. Haven't yet tried their pastas but I hear they are equally yummy.
Standard with extensive pizza selection, and a tad over-priced.  All in all, not super exciting, but a great diverse menu to please anyone.

Hungry for overpriced, small portioned pizzas? Do you like your pizza crust doughy and soggy? Do you like paying $12 for a full salad? Do you like your $12 salads to be mostly iceburg lettuce and lacking toppings? Yes?? Then you'll love CPK

I recently dined here and had a horrible experience. I noticed on my bank account that the charge was for more than I was actually charged. So I called the manager and gave her my card number and she said the server added a tip onto the total. I zeroed out the tip because I left this server a cash tip! Which means she added on more money. I couldn't believe she would steal from a customer. The manager refunded my money and apologized. She said she would talk to the server when she came in for her shift. I really hope this server has some major consequences. Who knows how many other people she's done this to who maybe didn't notice. If you eat here, make sure you check your bank statement afterwards! Places should not be able to get away with there employees stealing.

Excellent lunch with the grandparents a few days ago.  I am not a huge fan of chain restaurants, but this is one place everyone can agree on so sometimes we go for pizza and salad.   I always get a salad, in the interest of fitting into my skinny jeans again one day, but I usually manage to pilfer a small slice of pizza from someone else at the table!  This time I was pleasantly rewarded.  My grandmother ordered the five cheese pizza, which comes topped with tomato slices and basil.  OMG.  This may have been the tastiest pizza I have ever had.  Tons of cheese, nice flavors.  Are we really at CPK?  Wow.  I highly recommend this pizza.  We also had a cobb salad, broccoli-artichoke soup, and (my favorite) the moroccan chicken salad, which I usually order with the dijon balsamic instead of the dressing it comes with.  I always get either the moroccan chicken or the roasted vegetable salad, and they are both dynamite.  Everything we ate that day was tasty, and the service was excellent. Our server, Jessica, was pleasant, prompt, and very patient.  The hostess, whose name I can't remember (I remember she said she was Puerto Rican and Mexican, had dark curly hair and was very kind), was enthusiastic and polite. She was patient with my elderly grandmother, who takes awhile to walk to the table, and even spoke Spanish to her when she realized that might be easier for her (my grandma doesn't speak much English). So, even though CPK is not my first choice when dining out, I have to admit the memory of that 5 cheese pizza still stands out in my mind...maybe I will skip the salad, wear stretchy pants, and order one for myself next time.  :)
The food here was what you would expect from CPK, though the service was just okay on a recent visit.

Lost in Sac This is something you just DON'T want to be.  Sacramento is chain-store USA. Apple-Bee's, Fresh Choice, Fast-Food Fucking Mecca. They got shit I haven't even heard of. Because it's just that. Shit. Starving and at wits end, I digressed into verbally murdering my companion. How people can stand the Hungry Grace is beyond me, because I am Hyde when I haven't eaten.  Around and around in this City Forgotten By God, we drove. It was an odd time of day, so places that looked promising were closed. We chose to stick it out in a theater, which was bold for said Companion, as I could have ripped off head and vomited down throat.  However, there was nothing to vomit, due to the initial problem in the first place. After movie, we see a CPK across the street. It is late, I am weak from hunger and Friend is weeping from the new asshole I have so kindly installed, so we go.  I am not ecstatic, I order the pinot. I wanted the whiskey. The whiskey bottle.  I ordered the "new" seafood salad. Let me say, if you are Hungry in Hysteria, this ain't bad 'etall. Crab and shrimp with cabbage, edamamme, avocado, avocado and avocado with tortilla strips, I chowed the fuck down and didn't stop until my plate was empty. I liked the salad, it served me well. And kept me from Murder 1 in court.  Our server was detached and evidently hard of hearing, as he said "what?" to absolutely everything, served our appetizer when the pizza was half gone and forgot my wine entirely, but what do you expect, really?

Deng, the pizza is good here. If I cover up the price, I'd come here often enough to try every pizza until I'm done with it. If it was cheaper, it'd be a four star but too pricy for me! $10+ dollars for a personal sized pizza, eh. But if you go here, I recommend the Jamaican Jerk. Deng, chicken and other vegetables, and a bit spicy. The other pizza I tried was the Mango Tandoori or something. It really taste like tandoori... was weird. Anyways I'm sure most CPKs taste the same, so review for chain restaurants are kind of dumb. I remember though at the end, nobody would take our bill for like 15 minutes so we sat there for a while. I guess since it was guarantee tip they didn't feel like they should serve us as well. Buttholes.

The hubby and I love CPK, We were seriously disappointed that they closed the one in Stockton. Had to drive to Sac to get our fix. I had the miso shrimp salad which ive had before, Its always good, He had his favorite Thai chicken crunch salad, This chain is always consistent. Food is always good anywhere you go.

I actually don't think of CPK as a pizza place, but I like it.  Been a fan for ten+ years.  We were regulars at the Walnut Creek store when we lived there, and have been to the Arden store numerous times since moving to Arden-Arcade seven years ago. Between my wife and me, we've probably tried everything on the menu.  Do I like everything? No.  But most of it is good, and I definitely have some favorite items. For me, the Sicilian pizza is comfort food.  All meat with some zip. Comfort for the wife is the mushroom pepperoni and sausage pizza (a.k.a the "mupsa"). If you need a traditional kind of pizza, you can rely on either of the above. The roasted pear and gorgonzola pizza is one I am glad they brought back.  If you're a pizza purist that thinks pizza can only be tomato sauce, cheese, and meat, you just won't be happy.  They took this one off the menu for a while but people like me complained.  I don't order every time I come in, but I got it once in while.  A lot of others apparently felt the same way so they brought it back. The Thai chicken and BBQ chicken pizzas are also among my favorites and are probably original menu items.  And they have several good pasta dishes.  The kung pao spaghetti is really good (though I ask for it made with fettuccine), but it isn't Chinese food, OK? The service is consistently good.  I have panned service in places based on one or two visits, and it isn't like CPK has never had an off night.  But I have been here MANY... MANY... times, and would say that on average, they are spot on with great service.  We're regulars here for a reason. None of this is to say that I won't eat at a traditional pizza place.  In fact, there are plenty of times I prefer the family owned pizza parlor close-by in Carmichael.

Some decent vegan option here. I had a cup of soup and grilled 1/2  salad and the portions were big. My boyfriend ordered the carne asada pizza and said he was still hungry afterward. Even on a busy mall Saturday we got good service and the wait for a table was not to long.  The parking sucks, you might end up driving in the parking lot all day. The bathrooms are pretty small to however they were clean!

Good for what it is. Chain store pizza. More interesting toppings than other places, but still large scale everything previously frozen, assembly line pizza. Friendly welcoming staff and service. You could do a lot worse if you are at the mall, but I certainly wouldn't come out of my way to eat here.

Cpk has redeem my services! Last year, I came with my bf and service was horrible! But oh my, cpk's delicious hawaiin BBQ, jambalaya fettuccine, and crispy Mac and cheese appetizer filled our bellies with happiness! Waitress check on us and their apple sangria is yummy! will def visit again! :)
Quick review..4 stars for the pesto chicken pizza and 3 stars for the bbq chicken pizza. pesto was delicious but the bbq chicken pizza was overly sweet. The pizza dough/bread itself is good.

I know--I'm weird. I have never, ever been to California Pizza Kitchen until today. I probably never would have gone (chains always scare me--especially the kind found in airports), except that my elderly neighbor invited me to join her there for lunch. She's so sweet; I figured I'd give the place a try. We went to the location in Arden mall. Boy, have I been missing out! I was actually impressed! The menu was vast. I had a hard time deciding: salad or pizza? Maybe pasta? As the pizza devotee that I am, I opted for a pie. These choices were endless! I typically try the standard margarita pizza in new places, because you can really get a sense of the pizza that way. But it was lunch--I needed something light. Lots of veggies. The Greek pizza caught my eye--didn't sound much like pizza, actually, but yummy all the same. I asked the waiter for his opinion, and he agreed that it was tasty. I ordered. I loved my lunch! The Greek starts with a regular pizza crust, topped with melted mozzarella (no sauce). On top of that, they load diced cucumber, tomato, red onion, kalamata olive, and slices of avocado. Yum! The veggies were mixed with lots of fresh herbs, including chives and dill. This is then topped with homemade tzatziki sauce. (I heart tzatziki sauce!) They even provide extra so you can dip your crust. I'm not sure I can safely classify my meal as "pizza," but I can classify it as yummy! Next time, I'll have to try the margarita and see how well it stands up--and I will certainly go back.
Not that exciting and awkwardly expensive. Plus pizza are small.  I only went cause of school fundraiser, but would not go again...

This is my first visit to any California Pizza Kitchen.  My friend took me here toward closing time at night, and we each ordered a pizza.   I did not know that this is how it works here, where one person orders a whole pizza, but indeed, we were each able to eat the whole pizza.  It's a light pizza with a light crust.   It's good, and the ingredients are good, so it goes down pretty quick.  I must admit that I do prefer a more traditional pizza and crust, but this was good for a change of pace.  The crust is sort of like a thick tortilla.  Service was good.  I will give it 3.5 stars and an extra .5 for the service and environment.

I came to the Arden CPK with my husband and his cousins for dinner one night and I was greatly disappointed.  The way my family are, we are always joking around in a light mood.  It was around 7:30pm and there were about 4 tables being served including ours, so not a really busy night. When the waitress asked, what we would like to drink, one of us jokingly asked her, "Yes, can I have some more gatorade, please? I'm out?"  The waitress from Michigan rolled her eyes and replied, "Yeah, ok. Let me walk down to the gas station and get that for you" and walked away.  We brushed it off as her attempt for sarcastic humor and decided on our order.  We started out with the chips and dip while we waited for our food.  The four of us were sharing a the $10 appetizer of chips.  My husband's cousin, sincerely asked, "Are these chips bottomless?"  It was an honest and logical question seeing as many places do offer that.  The waitress looked at him like he was crazy and rolled her eyes and said, "Um...no" and just stared at him.  He then asked her, "well, would it be ok if we get some more please?" She walked away and reappeared a few minutes later with a small plate of chips and roughly dropped it on the table and walked off, not bothering to check to refill our drinks or asked how we are doing, whatsoever. After that blatant disrespectful service, I lost my appetite and was angry.  We called over the manager and explained the situation.  "Michigan" arrived with the food before he got there with all smiles and friendly attitude that we should have received from the get go.  A facade I knew she put on after the request from the manager that we asked of another waitress.   The manager came out and replied with, "I'm sorry, I don't know why she's acting like that.  Her restaurant just closed down and she was transferred so I don't know her personality that well."  As we continued to to explain that her attitude was not acceptable to guests, the manager then said, "I'm sorry, she's usually not like this.  I don't know why she's acting this way."  Really? I work in customer service and I understand bullshit.  First he said he doesn't know her, then he's saying she's not usually like this?  WTF? We told the manager that we understand if she might have had a bad day but it was her job to provide us with good, friendly, service and atmosphere.  If she can't handle that, she shouldn't be a server.  We were never rude to her and always requested items in a polite and respectful manner. I didn't eat the food because I was so disgusted with the waitresses attitude.  Her disrespectful and horrible service was enough for us to walk out. I would only go back to a different one because I still have a giftcard there to redeem.  Other than that, I would not go back there.
I ordered take out today for the first time at this place and learned that they only sell small pizza's. It's pricey, but tasted good. Would I go again? Yes
Great service! I highly recommend the southwestern corn chowder, Cobb salad and garlic chicken pizza!

A very good place to eat. A very clean restaurant and the waiters are always very nice and friendly.  I have been eating here for over 10 years and I have never had a bad experience. Parking can be hectic sometimes,but they do share the lot with a shopping mall and theatre.  I recommend the original, as in the original BBQ pizza($10.99), been getting it for years and its wonderful. I try other entrees, the newest entrees and I eventually always turn back to BBQ pizza. I wife recently has been getting the Thai Crunch salad($12.99)and its really good. So we share a pizza and salad. They also always put lemon in my water, which I really appreciate as well. I highly recommend this fine restaurant.

I recently went to cpk and had a fabulous experience. They just remodeled and everyrhing looks stunning. The regional manager was there and completely entertained my kids from the moment we walked in until we were seated. The food and customer service was amazing. Its one of our favorite spots

I visited CPK yesterday with a group of friends for lunch.  So far, everything I've eaten there has been really good.  This time I tried the Atlantic Salmon, and was extremely disappointed when my plate arrived.  The salmon was the skinniest piece of fish I had ever seen, by far NOT WORTH $18!  I'm sad to say that my lunch was the most expensive and not filling at all.

I always enjoy coming here on my lunch breaks. Their service is great and always on point. They have an excellent staff. They know I have a limited time to sit down and enjoy my meal so everything is made quickly, but still to perfection. I usually just sit at the bar and stare at the TV screen, watching sports while I eat. I'm a big fan of thier salads. From the Waldorf to the BBQ chicken. They are all great. I do recommend trying some of the small cravings. I think its the Korean bbq tacos. Excellent.

PROS: Big portions, more food for the same price as many downtown places.  GREAT salads, a half size is plenty for one person. I like the BBQ Chicken, the Thai Crunch and the Mediterranean.  Very vegetarian friendly! Lots of options, and our waitress was very knowledgeable and helpful with suggestions besides the obvious "vegetarian pizza." They even have vegetarian and vegan food lists to help! Good for dinner, good alternative to CHeesecake Factory or other busier places. The wait here is never very long. Clean environment, clean bathrooms.  The interior is nice but the servers uniforms need an update! The button down shirts and ties are a little stuck in the 90s and trying to be too fancy for this casual place.  good food, seems pricey but you get good food and lots of it!

Listen - normally I wouldn't waste my time reviewing a place like CPK. It would be like reviewing McDonald's you know? Like, if you have to go read a review on McDonald's then your either an lifelong vegetarian whose had a sudden change of heart or you've been living under a rock. Like, there is just no need to go and do something like review a mass chain. Their pizza's are in the frozen food aisle of your favorite grocery store for heck's sake. You don't need me! But...But.... CPK redeemed itself in such a grand manner that I had to write about it.  I mean - don't get me wrong. I love CPK. Their pizza is tasty (although expensive but I deal) and imagine my sadness when last year (on my birthday nonetheless) when we went to CPK to get the one and only pizza that I adore there - the Pear and Gorgonzola (with chicken please!) and they told me that it was....dis-con-tinued (tear! no! double tears!) !!!!! WHAT? It can't be! Yes it was.  Well - CPK ya done good. Imagine my renewed delight when I begrudgingly went to CPK (in my mind, what was the point? My shining star was gone...it wasn't worth the waste of a potentially good meal and 15 bucks) and found that they had revived the Pear and Gorgonzola.   Pretty sure the waitress thought I was the most excited crazy person ever because I just about orgasmed right there over pears and gorgonzola cheese.  Thank you CPK. Thank you.
Came in for late 1:30 PM lunch.  Food is good, but, the young staff suffers on the service side.  Not a great deal of communication in getting orders in, while restaurant is not crowded.

Here's my secret shame. I eat like I'm in the third grade. My favorite thing on the world is their Mac and cheese! Thank goodness I had kids who ordered this so I could discover it. Everything else here is great. Food. Staff. Vibe. It's CPK. it's awesome.

How is this place 3 stars? I disagree completely! Come on, it really deserves at least 4 stars for fantastic service, cool food menu, and awesome drinks. LOCATION: Very easy to find. Once in awhile, I'll make a stop at CPK with my friends after we shop. It's a very hard choice because there's so many places to choose from - CPK, Cheesecake factory, Sushi restaurant next door, and many more. I was hesitant the first time when my friend suggested that we should dine here instead of waiting for an hour for a spot in the Cheesecake factory. Yes, indeed a fantastic idea! All worth it! SERVICE: Had a the best service ever! I wasn't expecting much, but to my surprise - people there are AWESOME. They kept on checking back on our table, making sure everything is in place, our water poured, and our server gave us some awesome recommendations. I LOVE servers who gives me fantastic recommendation - they know best. 5 stars to service!  FOOD: So, here's what we got: (1) A MUST GET: Avocado Club Egg Rolls: 5 stars and beyond!! Love this! Chicken with avocado (now, you know it's awesome), tomatoes, cheese and bits of bacon, all wrapped in this CRUNCHY, CRUNCHY wrap- looks like it's been deep fried. Dip it in a tangy ranch sauce... oh man...now, I'm in heaven! (2) Roasted Artichoke and Spinach Pizza: My favorite thin crust pizza! It's hard to bite. The artichokes and spinach falls off with every bite, so I'll take a full bite when there's artichokes. There's bits of chicken, cheesy cheese! 4 stars. (3) Asparagus and Spinach Spaghetti: 4 stars! Asparagus, spinach, tomatoes, basil, cheese and chicken mixed in a stir-fried-like - because it seemed to oily, but so good tho! Ah! 4 stars! DRINKS: Server gave us some recommendation on wines - I liked it, not fancy wine and you can probably buy it in safeway. So, craving wine! **OVERALL: Can't go wrong with avocado! Get the SUPER CRUNCHY Avocado Club Egg Rolls and dip it in ranch - heaven! 4 stars to California Pizza King!

My five stars is solely for the taco pizza! Best pizza I ever had! I hope they still have it when we visit again. It seems like it will be one of those choices on the menu that will only last if ppl order it

The food was awesome but our server, Mario, ended up being pretty shady.  A couple of us in our group payed cash and if we didn't ask for our change back, he wouldn't have given it back to us. It took a lot of badgering for him to come back around and give us our change.

I have been to CPK plenty of times with the staff being great,  as well as the food. I went in today with my family, got the usual food was great. The waitress was a little off in the beginning but lightened up an was attentive with good customer service. We were sat by the bar which wasn't an issue but over hearing the crew (employees on & off the clock) cursing saying what the f***. It is disturbing to hear while im trying to eat my lunch with my kids and family. Then to look over at the greeting counter to see 2 employees kissing. This is beyond unacceptable. This is the reason why i giving them 2stars.

CPK always a solid option for good food.  The prices are too high, but they have unique pizzas with cravable flavors that you don't find elsewhere.  We usually go for lunch, and it tends to not be very busy.  Service is friendly and pretty prompt, and everything we've had is good.  My personal favorite is the "white" pizza, with added bacon!

Shared the Miso salad and Carne Asada pizza with the wife here before a movie last night.  The salad was great, pizza was good, but not great.   The salad had a miso dressing with enough crumbled wantons for an interesting flavor, and a perfect amount of crab and shrimp.   It's a little noisy, but I love the menu.  My only complaint is that they dropped our favorite "Tandoori Chicken" off.  Their pizzas definitely stand out from the competition - great variety, fairly healthy choices - it's great to have a pizza that's not soaked in grease.  A small salad and a pizza are perfect for two to split.  With a drink it might be $15-20 each out the door.

I go to California Pizza Kitchen whenever I am looking for something just slightly above casual. Good date place. I love their Thai Chicken Pizza. I also love that you can get half of one pizza type and a different kind on the other half. Their spinach and artichoke dip is great. There sliced fresh bread is great too. My favorite appetizer is the thai chicken eggrolls. So good. Their Sangrias are delicious too. My other half loves their Sicilian Pizza, but it's too much meat for my liking. Another great benefit to trying something new is that if you don't  like your food, you can switch it to something else. No hassle, no problem. They even encourage it. There service is great too. I have never had a bad experience here. The only not so great thing is that they took their tiramisu off the menu, and it was my favorite hands down to any other tiramisu that I have tried.
Food was delish and staff was very friendly. The service was a bit slow but they were busy and had bread to occupy us so that helped a ton!

I was very disappointed when I ordered the mushroom sausage pepperoni pizza because it was not as greasy as before and the basil that was added onto it totally threw me off. It added a sweetness that I wasn't expecting, and I could've done without it. I miss the old pizza style, they shouldn't have changed it. Our server was very nice and checked on us every now and then, he wasn't overwhelming us with his presence. The renovations are coming along, but I actually liked how it looked before. Overall this place should've never changed it's look OR it's menu. Very disappointing.

The food is great. However, the music today is like they are having a rave party. Very loud and energetic and annoying. Definitely a deterrent to returning. Salads here are so great. Fresh and clean tasting. Whole wheat pizza is fantastic.  Reasonable prices. Very friendly servers.

It would be hard to make a bad tasting pizza and I can say that CPK has mastered making unique pizzas. They definitely have a large range of pizzas to choose from. They had a chicken club pizza which is exactly like a chicken club sandwich, except they added greens on top. I had never seen a pizza with fresh greens on top but it did taste great. And this means you are gettting pizza and a salad for one! They have a lot of pizzas with salads on top, so I would recommend trying those! The flat bread pizza is a bit bigger than the regular crust pizza..that is why they charge $1.50 more to make your pizza flat bread. And we cant forget the free house bread, YUM! You have to ask for it so make sure you do...nice and soft!

A friend and I went out to dinner here. I have never been here as my friend has been here 'ages' ago, so we took awhile to order. We agreed on a appetizer & 'pizza' -roasted chicken with vegetables. One of the waitress bought us some of their style chips & guacamole and afterward came the appetizer (great dishes).  When we got our main course we received a dish , roasted chicken with veggies. I was confused because we came for pizzas. I told the waitress that we wanted the pizza; however my friend said we will take it, no worries it is our fault. Then went ahead and placed our order of the Roasted chicken pizza. We ate the chicken dish which was delicious !!! Loved it. The pizzas came afterward , I thought it was okay, maybe because I was a bit stuff from my previous course. We didn't finish our pizzas so asked it to go and our tab. The waitress then took and box our pizzas & brought the tab to us. She told us she took off the chicken dish since it wasn't what we wanted. I thought that was really nice of her; although we did love the chicken veggie dish! Something new to try. Great service & food.

Went with a group and found a staple in my pizza crust. A STAPLE. Told my server about it and she said "so do you want another one?" and I was a little taken aback by her blase attitude...does this happen often? Got another pizza sans staples. Later when I looked at the bill, I was charged for the pizza twice. We told the waitress and got it fixed but um....that's pretty sad customer service. I would have thought they would at least comp a pizza since it had a FRIGGIN staple in it... I dont know. That's just me.

Came here the other day, I have never been to an actual CPK before but always bought their frozen pizzas at Safeway. There wasn't many people here which was surprising.  We were seated promptly and put in our drink orders. I ordered their spaghetti bolognese, my sister ordered some kind of chicken sandwich as well as my mom. We also got a back up of our favorite pizza, the Sicilian pizza. My spaghetti was tasteless, and did not stay hot for very long either. My sister and mom both said they were meeh, okay but not the best they have had. The pizza though, NEVER FAILS. Fresh and hot, always tasteful. That is one thing I will always eat. Also our server never really came back to check on us until it was time to pay. That is why it is rated 3 stars.

The menu sucks. I am a PIZZA lover but this is just sad. its just a place that serves everything else and "by the way" we also have pizza. me and my friends wanted to try it out ut it wassing all that we expected. I expected we would have a wide variety of PIZZA SELECTION, but really i could have just gone to Pizza guys. I expected better. Don't get me wrong but a Pizza Kitchen is definitely suppose to look a lot different.

I went here with the family on Saturday. The experience started out good. We were greeted by the hostess and he seated us. Once we got our waiter it all went downhill from there. He did get our drinks correct and on time. We purposely went here at around 3:15 pm because we wanted to miss the lunch rush. So we ordered two appetizers and two pizzas to share. We got no bread until we literally asked three people for it. Then we got two plates of bread. We then had to ask for plates, napkins and silverware because none were provided. This should be standard. I didn't think we were Cavemen and had to eat with our hands or wipe our hands on our clothes.  But anyway, I can't even remember our waiter's name but we were seated directly to the right near the bar when you walk in at a table. The food is o.k. but the service is ugh and unacceptable. We ordered the Artichoke Dip some tacquitos and a pepperoni pizza and a sicilian pizza. The total bill came to around $63.00. Let's just say the waiter only got a $6.00 tip because I didn't have change. But come on we should have just bought some frozen CA pizzas at Safeway and called it a day. I will not frequent this business. The service was not cool.

I have been to several California Pizza Kitchens over the last 15+ years since I was a teenager.  I have always looked forward to the delicious food, quality service and innovative menu. This is by far the worst CPK I have ever been to in my life and am appalled that after I contacted them, I have yet to hear back from the store.  We had a take out order of a grilled vegetable sandwich on herb onion focaccia bread with a side caesar and the crispy mac and cheese bites.  We placed this order a full 40 minutes before arriving as it was lunch time and we figured they might be busy. Upon arriving, our side salad was not ready and had to wait another 7 minutes for it.  They also had no bread and after waiting 4 more minutes, we just took our bag and left as we had a state conference at the double tree across the street.   Upon opening our items, the sandwich was on the wrong bread, the caesar barely filled 1/4 of the container, and there was no sauce with the mac and cheese bites.  While we were starving and had a full 5 more hours of our conference we began eating only to find A HAIR in our sandwich!? I can only presume it is this location as the CPK's in LA, Ventura and Santa Barbara counties have always been spot-on. I would definitely pick the Cheesecake Factory next time I come to this area.  What a disappointment.  And to still not be called back after relaying my dissatisfaction is beyond poor customer service.

The 1st time we went here it was really good and the service was excellent, although it was nearly empty. We went here for lunch on the 4th of July, there were more people here but it was not packed. The service was really slow. The server sat our drink on the Crack between the two tables and it spilled. I guess they didn't see it happen because the people next to us had to give us their napkins. I asked 3 people for another drink and finally got one as we were leaving. We ordered the Kung pao spaghetti and it was really sticky, like they didn't rinse the starch from the noodles. Not worth the cost. Maybe it was just an off day...

I've been eating at CPK's since the early '90 in So Cal. Been going back time in time again. I was so happy to find out that Sacramento have one also. Still the same great taste. But, the service at this one at Arden is AWESOME! Sit at the bar and if you're lucky Alicia's there. She's rad!
Its a nice place you get more than pizza .They have a lot of vegan,vegetarian option.Kid friendly.Nice service .Just the wait times on Friday's are longer than usual.

I have been avoiding this place for a long time.   I was thinking it was a typical chain.    I was right and i was wrong.    The food was pretty good.   Shrimp Scampi pizza. Tasted close tot the real thing. Would have preferred fresh garlic to the roasted garlic on the pizza. The split pea soup was fantastic.   Now for the negative.  The waitress had no idea what beer they had on tap. she had to get a lit. I understand, but there was only 4 beers on tap/  Second, It 's a pet peeve of mine. Keep your freakinn kids in check. I would have thought this place was chucky feak'n cheese.  way too many kids running by my table. all night long. I'm not talking about one group of kids. there must of been 45 or so.   either way, ruined the meal.   tasty food,  wrong atmosphere.

We had a large party of 30 here for dinner the other night- half of them being kids.  We were loud, and I think there were a FEW (OK- maybe, more than a "few") straws flying around but our server was a good sport about it...Imagine having to fill and refill those little kiddie cups all night long.  Yikes! Definitely go for the Milan pizza or the Jambalaya Pasta- simply the best items served here.

This is one of me and my girls favorite spots, but we only go to the Arden one b/c the one downtown is not always easy to find parking.  It's a bit on the pricey side considering the portions they give you and the size of the pizza (slightly bigger than a personal size pizza for bout 12.99).  We loved the adobe chicken chowder but for some reason they decided to take it completly off the menu, even the servers don't understand why and said it was one of the most popular soups! The kungpao spaghetti ROCKS and chipotle chicken pizza with honey wheat dough is my new favorite next to the sicilian,  mmm soo gooOod!

I had dinner here last night and it was alright. I had their version of a Pizza Martguerita. Thin crust pizza is a fave of mine (I LOVE The Red Grape in Sonoma! See previous Yelp review) and here was quite good. I do think $11+ for a 8 inch pizza was pricey. Especially for what I ordered. But the service was quick--it was pretty packed--we sat at the bar and watched the show. The cooks were friendly and didn't mind you talking to them. The only negative was that there was only one bartender (it was Saturday nite for cryin' out loud) and it took a loooong time for us to get our drinks. Other than that, I would go back , but would try lunch this time.

There is nothing really extraordinary about this chain. The food is always decent and consistent. The only thing that would change my rating of this place would be their service. I've never had GREAT service here, but...ehh...average service. T he last time I went here, it seemed as if the server didn't give a flying f*ck about who he was serving and what he was doing. He gave me a glass of water with black crumbs in it and when I told him, he simply just grabbed the glass and served me a new one w/ no apology. Whatever, didn't bother me that much. As long as my food was good, then I'm satisfied.  I usually get the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine or Garlic Chicken Pizza. "The Works" pizza is aiiiiiiite and so is there Thai Crunchy Salad, or something like that.  Anyway, a chain is a chain. It's the same where ever you go...unless the Food God hates you and sets you up for failure.

corporate pizza places that serve more things then salads and pizzas? eh whatever...  the pizza here is great but over priced. the other foods here are good but again overpriced.  my favorite dish here is the mushroom ravioli pretty delish. when I eat pizza i want a nice pizza joint that just serves quality pizza without anything extra like waiting for a table, a server or fancy pant desserts! all that aside this place is fine for a lunch or a date, food here is good, servers here are fine not extraordinary and this place does take out.

As a family this is one of our favorites. They have gold fish our son can snack on and a very tight lid cup he can drink from. The service is always above expectations for us!!! And i think there fish tacos are the best in town!

I think the rating box has me down: Yay! I'm a fan. :) I've loved CPK ever since I tried it out in Las Vegas and Seattle/Bellevue. Kind of weird since they're not California Pizza Kitchens (in the technical sense). This CPK is definitely one that I like going back to, though.  The pizza is the same as I used to love it back home. Though sometimes our server is lacking -- one time we had a server who barely checked on us and forgot out bread (it's not a big a deal looking back on it, but two hungry college students remember that point).

Went here for dinner expecting to have a nice experience. Didn't turn out to be. The waiter took forever to take our order even though we place the menus folded on the side of the table. I ordered the sundried tomato and brocolli pasta dish (forgot the name of it) and asked him what kind of sauce was in it because I wanted red sauce. His answer was "the good sauce". The waiter was a fatty so I figured he knew what was good and took his word for it. So the food comes out and my dish has absolutely no sauce whatsoever....bummer. the girlfriend ordered the baby clam scallopini which was delicious so I ended up eating off of her plate. The service was horrible. He must have thought we were hmong and don't tip because the only 2 times we saw him was when he took our order and gave us the check(the food runner dropped off the food). It wasn't even busy! There was only 3 tables in the whole joint and we was spending all his time talking to the other tables. I give this place 2 stars because one dish was really good and the service was terrible.

Kids wanted pizza and I didn't want to spend money on normal take out, so I took them here. I had it years back, but my kids had never been here. Plus the mall is here, so I could feed them, then I could shop. Location is great. Two kids meal of pepperoni pizza, and cheeseburger pizza, and my roasted artichoke and spinach pizza came to $29 plus tip. The service was excellent. I didn't try the pepperoni, but I swear the cheeseburger pizza had a lettuce taste to it. It really tasted like a burger. My pizza was so good, my eldest kid even ate it. Artichokes and all. You can order any pizza thin crust, which we did to save extra calories. They were all friendly and always checked on us. My kids are 'crazy' and the side of ketchup they serve with the cheeseburger pizza  spilled on the floor and they never yelled at us, just said it was ok, and took care of it. But they didn't make me feel uncomfortable, know what I mean? Overall great. Pizza was fabulous. Wish I lived here to where I could try all their pizzas.

I've been a die-hard fan of California Pizza Kitchen for over 10 years!  One of my favorite dishes is the Chinese Chicken Salad with its crunchy Iceberg Lettuce and crispy Wonton strips. When this location decided to change their Iceberg Lettuce to Napa Cabbage, I was devastated! I asked the waiter why they had changed it from Iceberg to Napa and he said that all locations had changed. However, I ate at a San Ramon CPK just last week, and they used Iceberg Lettuce (without me requesting it) - there seems to be a discrepancy and I would like to know who is right.

Arrived at 6:30pm on a Friday, had a 15 minute wait.  The parking at the Arden Mall is awful, had to drive around 4 times to find a parking space.  Had to order for a vegetarian in the group,  the Wild mushroom pizza, Miso salad, Medit. Tortilla wrap and apple crumble for 3 people. Rosemary sandwich to go. $42 Was the perfect amount of food.
Very good food its never crowded the service is very friendly and the food comes out fresh and good.  Wish they updated there menu though and had specials based on season.

This was one of the restaurants we ate at during our 3 days in Sac-town. Great service.  We were greeted and served with a smile.  Very competent waitstaff too. The food was okay.  It's mall food.  Some of the pizzas were interesting but on the whole too salty and fatty.   Good in a pinch.
BBQ chicken pizza , no onions , no cilantro , thank you CPK for leaving me with the best type of pizza emblazoned into my mind forever !!!
Great roasted artichoke & spinach pizza! Yummy! Speedy pickup, perfect crust! I can't wait to eat inside!
I love this place the treat you always super nicely I have made friends with the the employes and love them! Good food great attitude towards customers

My mother always gives me gift cards for this place--I don't know why, but who turns down a gift meal? I am a pizza lover, and I like all the different options on the menu. However, this place tends to me noisy and crowded and overpriced. And they are stingy with the toppings! I know I'm a cheapskate, but for the price of one of their dinky foofoo pizzas you can get a delicious, hearty pizza the size of a trashcan lid at dozens of places in town. I will say that the new chicken pesto pizza is pretty tasty. But we got the works pizza and it was undercooked in the middle for some reason--it was still doughy and the cheese wasn't melted. I'm lucky to be alive! We should have sent it back, but the waiter didn't come by for 20 minutes, so we just ate around the raw bits. Yuck. Should've gone to Papa Murphy's.
Tasty food... Try the chipotle pizza !! :) tummy happy ! Everything tasted good... Good for veggie folks too !

I love coming here. The remodel is way more current. I heard that they are a test store for new items too so the menu has different stuff than other CPKs. I've never had bad service here, everyone is so nice!  Try the Thai crunch salad. It's the most amazing thing ever. My most recent server was Joel. He was very professional and quick. Really stood out of all the times I have been there.

Service and food today was HORRIBLE.  Seated and it wasn't busy.  14 minutes after being seated we got our drink order in.  (no bar drinks)  30 Minutes later we finally placed our food order.  1 hour into our wait, the food arrived. This might have been managed, had the food not been lousy.  The salmon was so overcooked it was ridiculous.  Burnt pizza, etc.  Went downhill from there.  Overpriced for what was delivered, poor execution, and lousy service.  Upon complaining to the manager he "was going to take care of it."  Apparently that meant a $4.50 credit for the lousy salmon on the salad. I can understand if you are out the door busy, service/time may suffer.  But, when you are slow and the service still sucks....thats just a reflection on management.

I am actually quite surprised by the less than awesome reviews for California Pizza Kitchen. I tempted to not go there but my boy kept urging that it's awesome etc. So we ended up there after a little shopping trip. The restaurant is nice, with huge booths each with its own window. A pretty big restaurant that would be good for groups. The hostess was sweet as well as our waitress. The waitress was a bit lacking in service, we did have to wait awhile for everything but not too bad. I got the California Club and he got the Jerk Chicken one.
