Next time we will have to get the famous BBQ chicken one! I've had the frozen version but I am sure the fresh one is much better. The pizza was nice and thin crusted. I liked the original crust a bit more thin the skinny one, which was a tad too skinny. The California Club was the winner out of the two. It had hunks of bacon, lettuce drenched in mayo, tomato, chicken and huge slabs of avocado. The Jerk Chicken one had good flavor, but wasn't too impressive.  The pizza was 13 dollars for an "individual" pizza. I did end up eating half, so it could be shared if you aren't super hungry.
The spicy chicken pizza was awesome! also the garlic pasta was good The Sangria was awesome.

CPK is always a crowd pleaser for lunch! Had a good lunch here over the weekend with my bf. The place was not crowded and very much like every other CPK. Food was served promptly and the waitress was courteous. Even noticed I needed a soda refill!  I usually order the Thai Chicken pizza. I think they put too much peanut sauce this time. Blehh~ Also we tried the new Hawaiian BBQ pizza. Nice variation on the BBQ one. It has pineapples too!  The Italian soda was somewhat gross. It tasted very bitter? Seems like they were using mineral water instead of 7up. Or maybe the 7up ran out of syrup. Oh well.

I came here the other night for the second time after YEARS.  I was grateful it was open on NYE when most of the other restaurants inside the shopping center were closed. This is a nice restaurant. It's a little on the dark side, (I could barely read my menu) but otherwise, the decor and vibe is pleasant. The food was good. My server was a very friendly and helpful young woman. I asked if their pizzas came in smaller sizes and she offered me a child sized version of the Hawaiian pizza I wanted, which was nice. I took a star off because I ordered a virgin strawberry daiquiri that tasted too sour.

GREAT SERVICE, GREAT FOOD! My fraternity and I have been coming here for the last three years to do out fundraising events! Each server/worker have been so great and friendly with our hectic large group of guests! I really appreciate how they go out of their way to serve each of us! Food wise: Last couple of times I've been here were UHHHMAZING! I have had their pizzas, pastas, desserts, appetizers, and alcoholic drinks! They make everything so delicious and perfect! Bartender definitely knows what he's doing ! And chefs/cooks are on point! All our orders came out in less than 15mins and were all freshly made!

If you like a thin crust Margarita Pizza as much as I do, look no further because you'll never find one except here! I've tried many places that say they make one but alas, they haven't a clue. The salads at CPK are generous and delicious.

I have been coming to this location for about 5 years now. I never had a problem until February 18th 2016.  My friend and I went out on a birthday lunch. It's been a while since we have met so we thought we would hang out and catch up on a few things. As we were in the front we were greeted "hello how's your day, please have a seat here" and as we responded "we are okay thanks for asking, can we pick a spot where there is no sun" and he said "oh I'll just put down the blinds, but that DID not help much". Anyways he was rude and we thought oh he's having a bad day or something.  Moving onto the waiter, I wish I knew his name but I for sure can recognize his face. He was a total wreck. Did not greet us well, slammed our drinks down, our food was great thanks to the chef and he tried to rush us out.  Since he gave us such a GREAT service we gave him a "zero tip and some written advice ".  Keep in mind that the restaurant was not packed. We were probably the only ones there with 2 other tables.  We won't be returning to this location AT ALL. 0 stars but 2 stars just because the food was great.
They make wonderful vegan pizza.  I have them on my speed dial.   People there seem vey friendly and welcoming.  Love the big screen TV, too.

First time coming to this location because moved closer to this area (regularly frequented the Bay Street Location). Comparing both services though, this location has Bay Street beat by several miles. The server was super attentive and didn't let our cups sit empty at the table without replacing them with a fresh new one. We didn't have to ask for the check or a take out box either because our waitress had it ready. For the life of me I cant remember her name, started with a C. Anyway, I would come back in a heartbeat. Bay Street can suck it because I will be coming here from now on.

Best CPK I have ever been too.  Hands down best staff and we met the manager and she was great too! Fresh food and always fun. I feel lucky to have this so close to home.  It does get cold in the restaurant but bring a sweatshirt and enjoy!

My mama wanted to come here as part of her birthday celebration, she loves this place. They have recently remodeled the interior so its light and airy and comfortable. They have a pretty extensive selection of items, as well as a 'light' menu. I chose the zucchini shrimp fettuccine dish and was pleasantly delighted! The zucchini was cooked perfectly with just enough crunch, not too soggy. It had a light but satisfying garlic olive oil dressing on it and it was under 600 calories! The service was just ok, we only saw our waitress when she initially took our order. Overall an enjoyable lunch time experience

I am the unofficial ambassador for CPK! Well, my family & friends seem to think this. Apparently I love this place soooo much,  everyone in my life thinks CPK is synonymous with ME! Their menu is large, but not overwhelming. You aren't limited to just pizza, and their flavors are boundless - traditional to unique. I've tried almost everything on their menu, I proudly state this by the way, and I can get down with almost anything...but I do have my faves and go-to's! All time faves list: Apps - spinach dip and the avocado egg rolls Salads - Chinese chicken salad and the Cesar Pizza - Roasted Chicken Garlic and Tostada, sans beans :/ Other - the Chicken sandwich on their delicious focaccia Desert - Butter-cake thing or apple crisp I do appreciate their libations, however they are steep. They pretty much only carry top shelf, so pricing is premium! Their cocktail list is girly, in general, but there are some good options - again, if you don't mind forking over your arm or leg. For this being an establishment in my top 5, this is lacking a star due to customer service. Turnover is high - so quality of employees isn't always on par. There have been good times...and bad, but I ALWAYS come back for the food. It comes with the territory of having one of your top 5's be a chain restaurant. CPK are my favorite initials :)

I've only been to CPK twice, the first time I had a large party and was satisfied. The second time it was with a group of three and it wasn't that great. We walked into a relatively empty restaurant with optimal seating. Having asked for a table for 3, the hostess told us it would take at least 15-20 minutes. I find that odd seeing as how there were tables everywhere. We come to find out that there are only three servers...on a Friday night...umm okay, sure. Server was nice, prompt, and friendly. I order a Margherita pizza and an Apple Martini. Food and drinks came out relatively quick. However, my pizza was cold. Not like, warm...but cold. As in, sitting out for at least 15-20 minutes cold. Cheese had completely solidified by the time it got to me...cold.

This was just as I expected so I am ok with giving it 3 stars. Food was tasty and just as I remembered from any CPK location.  Although, I did not receive the right order the first time it was quickly corrected and the day went on. Nothing new and nothing special.

I lost count on how many times we come here. We've been going there before their remodeling of the new CPK look.  The staff has always been great to us and never steer us wrong in food choices. We either go just for the pasta or the pizza, never both the same. There is also one person that recognized us as repeat customer; I don't know how because they are always busy there.  The happy hour is worth checking out. We haven't had a chance to do so, but based on their consistency with their food, I don't see why I can't recommend anyone not to go.

Great experience for dinner with the girlfriend.  We arrived around 6:30pm on a Saturday night.  It was pretty crowded, but was told there was going to be a 15 minute wait.  That was really quick for me, because I was expecting more of a 30 minute wait at the most.  Service was excellent!  Very nice, always checking up on us, multiple servers, and friendly.   Their food is normal, the typical variety of pizzas, about 10 different pasta choices, a few appetizers, soup, and salad.  The pizzas are all around $12 and filled me up.  It's thin crust, so it might not be super feeling, but it was perfect for me.  Based on food alone, I may give this place a 3.5 or 4 stars, but overall experience was worth a 5.  This is in a great location because it seems like every CPK is located in a mall.

I've been here 2-3 times since my last review, and it continues to make me happy. I met my bff here for a weekday lunch, and we ordered white corn guac and chips small plate (nice and sweet guacamole with lots of corn), she ordered the Sicilian (thin crust with lots of thin crisp meat toppings), and I ordered the California Club (kinda like the club sandwich in pizza form, with large slices of avocado. I LOVE avocado). We finished our meal off with their wonderful belgian chocolate souffle cake a la mode. This dessert is amazing, especially for a chain restaurant.

This restaurant chain have been around for a very long time, and I have never tried until recently. I've been on a Pizza craze lately trying pizza from everywhere. My Pizza was the California Club pizza, I felt like I was eating a salad on top of my pizza. It had fresh arugula, mozzarella and avocado slices on top of a cooked pizza with melted cheese and crispy bacon. All my fresh toppings kept sliding off. We also ordered a full sized Moroccan spicy chicken salad. Ehhh...... It was okay, I didn't like the dressing, the squash cubes and beet cubes were refreshing, chicken flavor was okay. MY server was really nice, the only good thing. My typical restaurant chain....never disappoints me too much because this is what I expect, mediocre food from a chain restaurant, especially being a part of the mall.

I came here with a group of 12 from work for lunch and had a great time! The restaurant is very open and inviting with a lot of light and decorative accents. Oh, and the food is delish! It was crowded for lunch, but not too crowded to where there was a wait, so the place had a nice energy. Our server was attentive and sweet, she may have been new because she didn't know what a Chimay was and seemed a little nervous around our large group, but her service level didn't suffer. Every time I come to California Pizza Kitchen (which is a lot!) I always know what to expect which is great! The food is extremely consistent (Yay no surprises!) and the service is always good. We ordered the Thai Chicken Lettuce Wraps and the Spring Rolls for the table which everyone seemed to love (both had meat in them) and I ordered the Margherita Pizza which was amazing!! It had the perfect mix of olive oil, basil and cheese and when I added red pepper flakes it was perfect! Nice thin crispy crust too. Their pizzas are big enough for two people to share with an appetizer, or for one person to eat and have plenty for leftovers! I also had a glass of their Berry Sangria which was so great! Sangria for me can be hit or miss, so I tried this one based on a recommendation from a coworker. It came in a huge glass and was so good and refreshing! Definitely recommended if you like or even kind of like sangria. I would definitely come back here for lunch when I have a little more time, or if I am hungry at the mall and want a nice meal or snack!

I like CPK.  I've always had good success with their food and service.   This CPK in the Arden Fair shopping area is no different.   The place is clean, well maintained and inviting.  I've been there at a variety of times and most times the place is fairly empty.  So service has always been immediate.  I've gone with my co-workers and by myself and never had to wait.   The pizzas are always my favorite but have tried the soups before and they are definitely good.  CPK provides pretty good value for the price of the food.  When I go solo, I will typically sit at the pizza bar counter and most times the pizza chef or one of the other servers will chat with me.  I have met one of the managers of the restaurant and was even given a comp meal.   The food isn't fabulous but it is predictably good, hot and fresh, so you always know what you are going to get.   I like this location and the food, so I'm definitely coming back.

I had a horrible experience this evening with CPK on Arden.  After a difficult day -- a car accident that left me laid up, I decided to order CPK for delivery through a 3rd party delivery service.  The delivery service's job is to pick up the order and deliver it, that's it.   When I ordered, however, on a system that send the information to CPK, along with notes, I ordered 2 salads and specifically added "please don't forget the dressing."  This note was made because this particular restaurant is notorious for leaving something out of to go orders.  Well, the delivery was made and, no dressing. I called the delivery service who was quite obnoxious about it (so I won't be using Food to You anymore), but did offer pick up my dressings.  Well 2.5 hours later, no dressing. I got in the car and drove over.  I called on the way to ask if they could have two dressings ready.  The young woman on the phone (the hostess I learned when I arrived) was very sweet and very helpful and apologized for the missing dressings.  So, when I arrived, I was quite surprised when the Manager decided to question ... a woman who ordered a delivery, because she had an accident and was laid up, who drove over 7 miles to retrieve dressing for those salads ... really?  She insisted I must have received the salad dressing because she personally had been helping with the take-out orders. Again, who lies about receiving salad dressing on a delivery order simply to drive over for 2 1/4 cup size dressings? When I questioned why she was questioning me, she said she wasn't (although when she left the man waiting next to me confirmed for me how rude she was to me!).  When she returned with 2 dressings she shoved them at me and barked "I'm sorry."  I could have just taken the dressing and left ... but she was so rude I asked if I could speak to the manager.  Well, it turned out SHE IS THE MANAGER!  Wow.  I work for a very large organization that serves customers (members actually) and if any one of my staff treated them the way she treated me, they'd have some pretty serious explaining to do. I've registered my complaint with CPK Corporate Offices as well. I won't be going back to CPK again.

Bad service. They were not accommodating at all. Mojitos SUCK there. They taste like minute maid lime aid. Sent it back and they were at first nice about it and let me choose a completely different drink. Then charged me $5 extra for changing my drink. Meanwhile the bartender was pointing at our table and was pissed. Choose a different restaurant

Came here for lunch before my shopping escapade with mama and my cousin.  I was SO excited to see that they had the California Club Pizza which was the first pizza I had my first time at CPK.  I went to the CPK in Roseville about a year ago and they didn't have it -- said it was discontinued -- and I was so disappointed. Seeing it here really brought back memories and it's still as great as I remembered it to be!! Mama approved as well as my cousin.  We also ordered the spinach artichoke dip which is served warm with tortilla chips. Yumm!  We came on a good day and there were carolers who came in and sang some holiday jingles while we finished up.  This location is great with lots of natural light from the windows (though I did ask to move somewhere so my eyes wouldn't be burned lol). Our waitress checked up on us frequently which is always nice. Mmmm, I'm just thinking about the California Club again just writing this :3

BEST DESSERT EVER!! My daughter and I for the first time ate the butter cake and we almost died and went to heaven! I believe this is one of the best desserts I have ever had at a restaurant in my entire life...at least my top 3...wow!

I came here to get my favorite pizza (Sicilian) but found out they had a rib eye and took the challenge.  This was by far the best ribeye I've had and the fingerling potatoes are to die for. It's obvious CPK wants to be more than just great pizza and they did it with the steak I had today.

Ordered (half) The Waldorf Chicken Salad. It was a tad pathetic.  Had four tiny pieces of Chicken (maybe 1/2" wide x 1 inch long. Seriously, not worth the $11.29 they charged me. My friend ordered the Thai crunch salad. Her salad on had two tiny pieces of chicken. Again, not worth the $11.49 she paid for it. Waiters are attentive and friendly. Salads were way overpriced for the amount of chicken received what you received. I did show my salad to the waiter and he took it back and had more chicken added. When my salad was returned it had  a good 2/3 of a cup of chicken. Also ordered a cup of their baked potato soup. That was stupendious. Mananger came to follow up with us. So...I raised the stars from two to four. Some times it pays to ask.  Special thanks to Austin our waiter for being a kind gentleman and meeting my complaint with a smile, and a can do attitude.

We visited CPK last weekend to grab a light dinner. It was about 7pm on Saturday and the restaurant was pretty busy (20-30 minute wait). The hostess offered us a couple open spots at the bar, so we didn't have to wait.   The chill of winter was settling in, so we asked our server of they could make a spiced cider or hot toddy. Our server wasn't immediately familiar with the recipe, but asked how we liked our toddy's and quickly came back with a self-serve style assortment of hot whiskey, tea, lemon, etc. It was exactly what we were looking for to start our meal! We ordered the mushroom pizza and split pea soup for dinner. The pizza dough was light and crisp, while the vegetables were perfectly cooked. The soup was similarly wonderful.  This was our first time here, and will definitely be back!
This is a great spot, plenty of parking although can get busy on the weekends. Superb staff. I had the BBQ CHICKEN SALAD it was really good! And sipped on the CARIBBEAN SUNSET SANGRIA. Super good!

This old standby, and one of the first to serve "gourmet" pizzas with non-traditional toppings on a non-traditional crust, is still consistent with their salads and pizza.  Service was average for a fast-paced and busy environment.  Our server was friendly enough, but we had to flag her down for a couple items. One thing that I hate at restaurants is being served bread that isn't warm or hot or fresh out of the oven.  This place is known for their oven-baked pizzas, so I would assume a loaf of their starter bread would be nice and hot, crunchy on the outside, soft in the middle.  This bread was COLD!  Fresh out-of-the-fridge cold!  So you know when you put a freshly baked loaf of bread in the fridge, it becomes hard and chewy and COLD!  Why would anybody serve that, and with some hard ass, cold butter to boot?!!!  We even asked our server if the bread was supposed to be cold.  She said yes.  That's ridiculous!  Seriously, CPK chefs/management...bread is not supposed to be served cold!

Tasty, not greasy, just what I was craving but didn't know! I've never been to a CPK, but this was a bit more elegant than I had expected. The crab and lobster flatbread was good, the crab was only slightly overcooked.  Not too fishy, but be sure to not order this as a main dish as it is not very filling. The biggest surprise was the sunny side up egg, potato, and bacon pizza.  The pizza bread was slightly thinner crusted than anticipated, but the egg and bacon on pizza was pleasantly surprising!  The potato was baked so tasted like chips.  It would be nice if there was an option to have additional eggs added onto the pizza because 2 doesn't seem like enough. Kids menu items were quite generous!  Fusilli and Alfredo was more than enough for my 5 year old.  The personal pizzas were more than enough for my older two.  Of course the pepperoni caused some greasiness, but it wasn't excessive. Bathroom was clean and kept up. Overall good experience, I would return.

Thank you Ashley, our waitress, and Loren the manager for the amazing experience you gave us! It was beyond our expectations :) You simply made our day. I came here tonight with my family for the first time, Usually I order by phone and pick up my pizza when it is ready. We thought to come here and sit for a change! Long story short, the first part of the experience wasn't that good as we waited for so long! Ashley showed up soon after I told the guy on the counter. She, politely and genuinely apologized which made us feel much better :). She then offered us an appetizer for free to make it up for us, so far so good!.  We ordered our favorite pizzas: Margarita pizza ( + tomatoes and extra basil) and the BBQ chicken pizza. We also ordered the free appetizer, some pasta. By the way, I love the bread with the olive oil they serve for free.  We were so happy with the quality and the taste of our food, we enjoyed it. Ashley kept on checking on us making sure we are happy and enjoying our meal and time. We even chatted a little bit about our families and personal lives.  Once we were done, Ashley put the leftovers in boxes, thanked us, wished us a good night and then left. I was confused on where I should pay, i thought they will bring me the check!!! So I went and asked Ashley, here manager Loren was there and she said: "I got this, you waited so long (it wasn't that long actually) so i got this :) don't worry about it" and I was speechless, didn't know what to say.  It was, by far, the most amazing experience I had here in Sacramento, not because of the free food and the amazing service I received, but because they were sensitive and sincerely felt sorry for letting us wait. Loren and Ashley were sincere, polite, amazing and full of surprises. I would've been so happy with the free appetizer but no, they went beyond what was expected and made our night unforgettable .. this is what i call Delivering Happiness not just amazing food :).  Again, Thanks Loren and Ashley and congratulation California Pizza Kitchen for having such an amazing, loyal and creative people.

Whenever I get hungry but don't know what to eat, pizza never fails to disappoint. I enjoyed CPK, but it wasn't absolutely amazing. in terms of pizza, I think the unhealthier deep dish pizzas from BJ's probably hits the spot even more.  What I did enjoy thoroughly...was their linguine and clams pasta. The sauce was scrumptious, must try!

finally returned to try out the jambalaya & I'm so glad I did! it was absolutely delicious; a beautiful creole sauce, plenty of shrimp, chicken and sausage and a nice little kick in each bite.    the service was lot better this time around. I think his name was Jason or maybe James, I know it started with a J for sure. lol, he attended to our table very well. welcomed us with a friendly tone and smile. he also informed me about their rewards program. I guess you fill it out at the table and then the server adds it into the system. I was told I should get an email as a response but I never got anything... so I don't think he ever added me into the system...

This was the first time eating at this location. Our server Brianna was really awesome. She was on top of her game. She brought our food to our table in a timely manner and she even brought refills without us even having to ask for one. Good looking out! The food was wayyyyy better than any other location we've eaten at. That pizza was off the hook! I send my thanks to the cooks and Brianna for doing such a great job! Oh! And not to mention the seemingly updated décor compared to the other locations.

I'm not a fan of pizza but I have to say this place make me changed my mind! I had the vegetables plus sausage pizza, it was the best pizza I had in my life! Would like to take my mom here next time so she can have a great one in a life time! Boy why didn't I try this place before? I did long ago but I had salad or other dishes! Good thing I have pizza this time!
The food was good. The service was very slow for the amount of people that were there at the time. Took an hour before we got our food from the time after ordering.
Love love love pizza lover love this place great food drinks and salads the Bay Area locations are my fav but sac location not as good but decent  CPK has my heart delicous

We absolutely LOVE CPK. We eat there about once a week. We always order the same thing and the servers know it. We usually don't even have to order anymore. We always feel welcome and have always had great service. On a side note, the cheesecake at CPK is better than The Cheesecake Factory. We are beginning to realize, it's kind of an expensive way to dine regularly, so we are slowly cutting back.

You would think a place that calls themselves a "Pizza Kitchen" would have great pizza. I think I could have had a better pizza from the frozen section of the grocery store by a guy named Tony. The pepporoni pizza I ordered was underdone, soggy, greasy, and tasteless. The only saving grace to this experience was that the waiter didn't charge me for it, and that the Big Spoon nextdoor was open for dessert.

I love their pizza here because all the ingredients are fresh and the dough is kind of sweet.  I also ordered the chicken marsala and it was good.  Their portions are pretty big.  However my favorite is "The Works pizza.

My friend and I came here for lunch to enjoy one of their salads.  It took forever to get our salad, and when salads finally arrived my friend got a LOT more than she ordered.  Took a few bites of her salad and bit on something HARD and shattered a tooth.  She did not realize how badly her tooth was damaged until we got home.  One extration and a bridge later and she should be a new person.  How in the world does a restaurant expect to get repeat customers when this happens?  Sadly, that is our last trip there.

Typical mediocre chain restaurant. I've only had the pizza, so I can't speak to the other items on the menu, but the pizza is average at best and not worth the inflated price. The atmosphere is typical downtown fake cool. Do yourself a favor and go to One Speed instead.
Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza could do better without the bacon.

Went here this afternoon with a friend and it was okay.  The pizza was a bit dry, but loaded with garlic.  We got a cheese bread appetizer thing too that was quite good.  The service was just okay however, and we where one of maybe four tables, so that made me a little less than thrilled with this place.  We got a dessert too, it was a chocolate souffle  al a mode and it was yummy.  Maybe I am just a chocolate fan though, because it did remind me of a warm brownie.  So, I won't be rushing back to it, but I won't turn my nose up at it either.

Im from Los Angeles and frequently eat at CPK and have always had pleasant experiences, that was far from the case here at the CPK next to Sacramento's Arden Fair Mall.  lets start with the decor it is a casual yet nice restaurant, it was welcoming because it looks like every single other CPK. you come in and sit down at a nice restaurant where the centerpiece is a ordinary food turned into culinary art. every single pizza's ingredients and taste are brilliantly combined into extraordinary italian comfort food. thats how ive alwasy felt about CPK but this particula location managed to make the Thai Chicken Pizza (my favorite!) taste mediocre it was overcooked making it very dry and there was only a few scraps if chicken on top. I also ordered the Jambalaya, the pasta was good yet the sausages tasted like the frozen ones that you heat up. the shrimps and crawfish were overcooked and had a rubbery consistancy. after i ate halfway through the pasta the dish was lathered in the oil left behind, i could litterally collect all the left over oil and deep fry some chicken. but the food wasnt the only thing leaving a bad taste in my mouth the service was HORRENDOUS. i walked in and noticed that there were about 10 to 12 workers, they actually outnumbered the patrons present. yet with 10+ workers no one offered me a table or even gave me a greeting until about 6 minutes of standing in front of the front desk. our waitress seated us and asked if we wanted drinks, that would be the last time she asked us about our drinks, she didnt even try to refill our glasses until we called for her after searching around the room for 8 minutes. she did not serve us bread either we had to ask another server because you guessed it our waitress was no where in sight. our pizza came quick, but the pasta didnt come until we had finished our pizza, i noticed a plate sitting on the ocunter for about 15 minutes and when our waitress finally came out of the back BINGO we were the winners that was our plate! horray! our waitress walked by and and as she cleared the plates she gave us a pity "how was the food" in a arrogant nonchalant voice that screamed she was not paying attention to our answer, we could have said this was the worst pizza ever, and she would have still responded thats wonderfull. the place was very unporfessional i saw one of the cooks picking something off of one of the pastas and pizza and eating it before it would be served. while other waitors were giving the food to the wrong tables all around it was complete chaos. i would recomend others to try CPK but advise them to go to any CPK OTHER THAN THE ARDEN LOCATION STAY AWAY! i wont be coming back.

I decided to give the CPK another try since my first two didn't go so well.  But maybe that's because the other locations I went to weren't in Cali!?  You know, it's like KFC is better in Kentucky.  Anyway, a large ceasar salad and pepperoni pizza to share with my hubby for lunch was good.  Salad was fresh and crisp without too much dressing, and I like the shredded parmesan!  The pepperoni pizza was light enough for lunch and tasty.  Only negative is I felt it was a little pricey for salad and pizza and the ambiance was a little dry.

I love the food here. Always have. Went on a Sunday night and it wasn't too busy. Very friendly and attentive service. In always have a good experience here( much better service then the downtown location!!)

Meh....CPK as i like to call it does not satisfy my pizza cravings...  First of all its a little over priced. There is nothing really big that makes this chain stand out. Every time I go I try and be a little more impressed but it doesn't work. I rather go to round table or some other place. Their service isn't really that great. It's so so. I have had better experiences...The only good thing about this restaurant is that there is a big spoon next door.

I think this is against yelp review policy as I work here, but I will be honest about this place to help those who are looking to eating here for the first time..... Want a salad? Try Jack's Urban Eats Want a pizza? Try Luigis, Wenellis, or Chicago Fire Want pasta? Try Espanol on Folsom Blvd CPK has one thing going for it and that is, it is consistent. The Arden CPK is better than most other CPK's in that we use a wood fire oven for or pizzas where as most other ones use gas, which really kill the thin crust pizzas. However, we're overpriced by a long shot and alot of the chicken we use is already cooked and is thawed out before serving. We're not unique in this as Elephant Bar, Cheesecake Factory, Applebees, Mimi's, etc all tend to do this. The serving staff is a mix of pro's and those who shouldn't be in the business at all, but thats like most places. They are also changing the decor of the place so hopefully it will start to look up to standard as we were rocking that In-N-Out look for far too long. Also, there is a Roseville store already open and a new in Downtown going in. I will warn you about new chain stores, they take awhile for the kinks to be worked out so don't expect your socks to be blown off. I avoid new chains like the plague. Took the Outback and BJ's in Elk Grove almost six months to get in the groove of things.

oh california pizza kitchen, how youve failedddddddd me! i used to be a fan of this chain, albeit not a huge fan, but a fan nonetheless. last month, i came here with a party of 8. i phoned ahead for seating and i was told that the wait for my party of 8 would be 15 minutes, 20 at most. we were on a time crunch, so i needed to know exactly when we were going to be seated. i went ahead and made the reservation. when we showed up shortly after, there wasnt a table available for us yet. we were told it was going to be another 20 minute wait. =P so we decided to wait anyway, hoping that they would call us sooner since 15 minutes have already elapsed since we initially called. 20 minutes pass and we still arent called so i go back inside to ask how much longer its going to be, and the rude hostess told me that they're busy (eventho i see plentttttttttty of empty tables scattered about and when we first arrive the restaurant was nearly empty!!) so we had to wait. nearly an hour after we initially made the reservation, our party of TWO was seated, not EIGHT! =P so i told the host that we actually had a party of 8 not 2. he continued to seat us in a booth and told us that he would check. he comes back and tells us that the tables for our remaining six were still being cleared and they were still trying to figure out where to put them. WTF?! we made a reservation for EIGHT!!! not TWO! why would u split us apart??? whyyyyy would you not seat us when we arrrived when you had PLENTY of tables available?? WHY CPK, WHY?!  after being told that, we prompty got up from our booth for TWO and left with our party of EIGHT to a restaurant elsewhere. nobody apologized on their behalf either. not the hostess that made the mistake, not the host that seated us, not even a manager. so if i could give negative stars, i totally would!

Conveniently located at Arden Mall, CPK provides decent food for a decent price.  Its definately not gourmet by any stretch of the imagination, but the food is good.  The appetizers are good, as are certain pizzas.  The staff is fast, efficient and consistently check in with you to ensure that you have everything you need.  Overall, its worth it, but there are better places with better food.  However, due to its location, it does see a lot of traffic and getting a table can be difficult at times.  Browse the nearby bookstore until your table becomes available or grab a coffee from the nearby vendor.

is it weird that i like to have pasta at a pizza place? well, i don't label CPK a fully pizza joint but one of these days, i will try their pies. in the meantime, ill keep ordering the jambalaya every time i go!

this place always seems to be packed and busy no matter what time of the day or week. cpk is a consistent place to go to get interesting pizza and a variety of other foods as well. whats cool about cpk is that they have  something for everyone. the last time i was here we came for one of our cousins bdays. so my pizza became a cornucopia of like 6 other pizzas haha. my personal favorites are still the thai, bbq, chipotle, jamaician jerk.  the various rolls and spinach dip are all good starters as well. the only thing i really don't like it when i am here is usually whomever controls the television watches CNN for some reason, the bartender or whomever makes the drinks are skimpy on the alcohol and sometimes seating is a little to in proximity to other people, so conversations are like at the bar.

We were there last nite to celebrate the birthdays of two children aged 5 and 3. Our experience was disappointing. The only time the waitress smiled was while presenting the check. She was cold during the entire time. We ordered 3 cocktails, an appetizer, three entrees and a kids meal. The appetizer was just about average. The Chipotle Pizza was great, The Tequila Lime Pasta and the Veggie Pasta were great too.  We asked for extra plates and the waitress looked at us as though we asked her for something out of the ordinary. The cocktails were watered down. We brought our own icecream cake. We asked for plates to serve the cake. The plates provided to us were dirty. One of the plates had a lot of coffee stains in it. I have had better experiences at ths same location during lunch time. Cheese cake factory would have been a better option. The check came to $74 and we still added a 10% tip eventhough the waitress did not deserve any.
